definitions.definition: To have an effect on by using gentle or subtle action; to exert an influence upon; to modify , bias , or sway ; to persuade or induce .
examples: The politician wants to influence the public.
I must admit that this book influenced my outlook on life.

definitions.definition: To exert , make use of one's influence.
To cause to flow in or into; infuse ; instill .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To have an effect on by using gentle or subtle action; to exert an influence upon; to modify , bias , or sway ; to persuade or induce .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To exert , make use of one's influence.
( transitive , obsolete ) To cause to flow in or into; infuse ; instill .
